00001 /**
00002  * \file Geod.cpp
00003  * \brief Command line utility for geodesic calculations
00004  *
00005  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010, 2011) <charles@karney.com>
00006  * and licensed under the LGPL.  For more information, see
00007  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00008  *
00009  * Compile with -I../include and link with Geodesic.o GeodesicLine.o DMS.o
00010  *
00011  * See the <a href="Geod.1.html">man page</a> for usage
00012  * information.
00013  **********************************************************************/
00014 
00015 #include <iostream>
00016 #include <sstream>
00017 #include <string>
00018 #include <sstream>
00019 #include <fstream>
00020 #include <GeographicLib/Geodesic.hpp>
00021 #include <GeographicLib/GeodesicLine.hpp>
00022 #include <GeographicLib/DMS.hpp>
00023 
00024 #include "Geod.usage"
00025 
00026 typedef GeographicLib::Math::real real;
00027 
00028 std::string LatLonString(real lat, real lon, int prec, bool dms) {
00029   using namespace GeographicLib;
00030   return dms ?
00031     DMS::Encode(lat, prec + 5, DMS::LATITUDE) + " " +
00032     DMS::Encode(lon, prec + 5, DMS::LONGITUDE) :
00033     DMS::Encode(lat, prec + 5, DMS::NUMBER) + " " +
00034     DMS::Encode(lon, prec + 5, DMS::NUMBER);
00035 }
00036 
00037 std::string AzimuthString(real azi, int prec, bool dms) {
00038   using namespace GeographicLib;
00039   return dms ? DMS::Encode(azi, prec + 5, DMS::AZIMUTH) :
00040     DMS::Encode(azi >= 180 ? azi - 360 : azi, prec + 5, DMS::NUMBER);
00041 }
00042 
00043 std::string DistanceStrings(real s12, real a12,
00044                             bool full, bool arcmode, int prec, bool dms) {
00045   using namespace GeographicLib;
00046   std::string s;
00047   if (full || !arcmode)
00048     s += DMS::Encode(s12, prec, DMS::NUMBER);
00049   if (full)
00050     s += " ";
00051   if (full || arcmode)
00052     s += dms ? DMS::Encode(a12, prec + 5, DMS::NONE) :
00053       DMS::Encode(a12, prec + 5, DMS::NUMBER);
00054   return s;
00055 }
00056 
00057 real ReadDistance(const std::string& s, bool arcmode) {
00058   using namespace GeographicLib;
00059   return arcmode ? DMS::DecodeAngle(s) : DMS::Decode(s);
00060 }
00061 
00062 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00063   try {
00064     using namespace GeographicLib;
00065     bool linecalc = false, inverse = false, arcmode = false,
00066       dms = false, full = false;
00067     real
00068       a = Constants::WGS84_a<real>(),
00069       r = Constants::WGS84_r<real>();
00070     real lat1, lon1, azi1, lat2, lon2, azi2, s12, m12, a12;
00071     real azi2sense = 0;
00072     int prec = 3;
00073     std::string istring, ifile, ofile;
00074 
00075     for (int m = 1; m < argc; ++m) {
00076       std::string arg(argv[m]);
00077       if (arg == "-i") {
00078         inverse = true;
00079         linecalc = false;
00080       } else if (arg == "-a")
00081         arcmode = true;
00082       else if (arg == "-l") {
00083         inverse = false;
00084         linecalc = true;
00085         if (m + 3 >= argc) return usage(1, true);
00086         try {
00087           DMS::DecodeLatLon(std::string(argv[m + 1]), std::string(argv[m + 2]),
00088                             lat1, lon1);
00089           azi1 = DMS::DecodeAzimuth(std::string(argv[m + 3]));
00090         }
00091         catch (const std::exception& e) {
00092           std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of -l: " << e.what() << "\n";
00093           return 1;
00094         }
00095         m += 3;
00096       } else if (arg == "-n") {   // Deprecated and so not documented
00097         a = 6378388;
00098         r = 297;
00099       } else if (arg == "-e") {
00100         if (m + 2 >= argc) return usage(1, true);
00101         try {
00102           a = DMS::Decode(std::string(argv[m + 1]));
00103           r = DMS::Decode(std::string(argv[m + 2]));
00104         }
00105         catch (const std::exception& e) {
00106           std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of -e: " << e.what() << "\n";
00107           return 1;
00108         }
00109         m += 2;
00110       }
00111       else if (arg == "-d")
00112         dms = true;
00113       else if (arg == "-b")
00114         azi2sense = 180;
00115       else if (arg == "-f")
00116         full = true;
00117       else if (arg == "-p") {
00118         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00119         std::istringstream str(argv[m]);
00120         char c;
00121         if (!(str >> prec) || (str >> c)) {
00122           std::cerr << "Precision " << argv[m] << " is not a number\n";
00123           return 1;
00124         }
00125       } else if (arg == "--input-string") {
00126         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00127         istring = argv[m];
00128       } else if (arg == "--input-file") {
00129         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00130         ifile = argv[m];
00131       } else if (arg == "--output-file") {
00132         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00133         ofile = argv[m];
00134       } else if (arg == "--version") {
00135         std::cout
00136           << argv[0]
00137           << ": $Id: cf91021228a70523398402614089f62d34edee10 $\n"
00138           << "GeographicLib version " << GEOGRAPHICLIB_VERSION_STRING << "\n";
00139         return 0;
00140       } else
00141         return usage(!(arg == "-h" || arg == "--help"), arg != "--help");
00142     }
00143 
00144     if (!ifile.empty() && !istring.empty()) {
00145       std::cerr << "Cannot specify --input-string and --input-file together\n";
00146       return 1;
00147     }
00148     if (ifile == "-") ifile.clear();
00149     std::ifstream infile;
00150     std::istringstream instring;
00151     if (!ifile.empty()) {
00152       infile.open(ifile.c_str());
00153       if (!infile.is_open()) {
00154         std::cerr << "Cannot open " << ifile << " for reading\n";
00155         return 1;
00156       }
00157     } else if (!istring.empty()) {
00158       std::string::size_type m = 0;
00159       while (true) {
00160         m = istring.find(';', m);
00161         if (m == std::string::npos)
00162           break;
00163         istring[m] = '\n';
00164       }
00165       instring.str(istring);
00166     }
00167     std::istream* input = !ifile.empty() ? &infile :
00168       (!istring.empty() ? &instring : &std::cin);
00169 
00170     std::ofstream outfile;
00171     if (ofile == "-") ofile.clear();
00172     if (!ofile.empty()) {
00173       outfile.open(ofile.c_str());
00174       if (!outfile.is_open()) {
00175         std::cerr << "Cannot open " << ofile << " for wrting\n";
00176         return 1;
00177       }
00178     }
00179     std::ostream* output = !ofile.empty() ? &outfile : &std::cout;
00180 
00181     const Geodesic geod(a, r);
00182     GeodesicLine l;
00183     if (linecalc)
00184       l = geod.Line(lat1, lon1, azi1);
00185 
00186     // Max precision = 10: 0.1 nm in distance, 10^-15 deg (= 0.11 nm),
00187     // 10^-11 sec (= 0.3 nm).
00188     prec = std::min(10, std::max(0, prec));
00189     std::string s;
00190     int retval = 0;
00191     while (std::getline(*input, s)) {
00192       try {
00193         std::istringstream str(s);
00194         if (inverse) {
00195           std::string slat1, slon1, slat2, slon2;
00196           if (!(str >> slat1 >> slon1 >> slat2 >> slon2))
00197             throw GeographicErr("Incomplete input: " + s);
00198           std::string strc;
00199           if (str >> strc)
00200             throw GeographicErr("Extraneous input: " + strc);
00201           DMS::DecodeLatLon(slat1, slon1, lat1, lon1);
00202           DMS::DecodeLatLon(slat2, slon2, lat2, lon2);
00203           a12 = geod.Inverse(lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2, s12, azi1, azi2, m12);
00204           if (full)
00205             *output << LatLonString(lat1, lon1, prec, dms) << " ";
00206           *output << AzimuthString(azi1, prec, dms) << " ";
00207           if (full)
00208             *output << LatLonString(lat2, lon2, prec, dms) << " ";
00209           *output << AzimuthString(azi2 + azi2sense, prec, dms) << " "
00210                   << DistanceStrings(s12, a12, full, arcmode, prec, dms) << " "
00211                   << DMS::Encode(m12, prec, DMS::NUMBER) << "\n";
00212         } else {
00213           if (linecalc) {
00214             std::string ss12;
00215             if (!(str >> ss12))
00216               throw GeographicErr("Incomplete input: " + s);
00217             std::string strc;
00218             if (str >> strc)
00219               throw GeographicErr("Extraneous input: " + strc);
00220             s12 = ReadDistance(ss12, arcmode);
00221             if (arcmode)
00222               l.ArcPosition(s12, lat2, lon2, azi2, a12, m12);
00223             else
00224               a12 = l.Position(s12, lat2, lon2, azi2, m12);
00225           } else {
00226             std::string slat1, slon1, sazi1, ss12;
00227             if (!(str >> slat1 >> slon1 >> sazi1 >> ss12))
00228               throw GeographicErr("Incomplete input: " + s);
00229             std::string strc;
00230             if (str >> strc)
00231               throw GeographicErr("Extraneous input: " + strc);
00232             DMS::DecodeLatLon(slat1, slon1, lat1, lon1);
00233             azi1 = DMS::DecodeAzimuth(sazi1);
00234             s12 = ReadDistance(ss12, arcmode);
00235             if (arcmode)
00236               geod.ArcDirect(lat1, lon1, azi1, s12, lat2, lon2, azi2, a12, m12);
00237             else
00238               a12 = geod.Direct(lat1, lon1, azi1, s12, lat2, lon2, azi2, m12);
00239           }
00240           if (arcmode)
00241             std::swap(s12, a12);
00242           if (full)
00243             *output << LatLonString(lat1, lon1, prec, dms) << " "
00244                     << AzimuthString(azi1, prec, dms) << " ";
00245           *output << LatLonString(lat2, lon2, prec, dms) << " "
00246                   << AzimuthString(azi2 + azi2sense, prec, dms);
00247           if (full)
00248             *output << " "
00249                     << DistanceStrings(s12, a12, full, arcmode, prec, dms);
00250           *output << " " << DMS::Encode(m12, prec, DMS::NUMBER) << "\n";
00251         }
00252       }
00253       catch (const std::exception& e) {
00254         // Write error message cout so output lines match input lines
00255         *output << "ERROR: " << e.what() << "\n";
00256         retval = 1;
00257       }
00258     }
00259     return retval;
00260   }
00261   catch (const std::exception& e) {
00262     std::cerr << "Caught exception: " << e.what() << "\n";
00263     return 1;
00264   }
00265   catch (...) {
00266     std::cerr << "Caught unknown exception\n";
00267     return 1;
00268   }
00269 }
